Race.SpecificTitle: Mayor-President -- Metro Council, City of Baton Rouge
Councilman -- Metro District  2
Councilman -- Metro District  5
Councilman -- Metro District  7
Councilman -- Metro District  9
Councilman -- Metro District 10
Councilman -- Metro District 12
PW (Crisis Stabilization Center) -- 1.5 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge (the "Parish") be authorized to levy a 1.5 mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Parish (the "Tax") (an estimated $6,100,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2017, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2026, and shall the proceeds of the Tax (after paying necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used entirely and exclusively for the purpose of operating and maintaining a crisis stabilization center that will provide short-term behavioral health services to adults who are experiencing a crisis related to a mental health condition, and providing funds for adequate administrative and support staff in connection therewith?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW (Green Light Property Tax) -- 5.0 Mills - MC - 30 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge (the "Parish") be authorized to levy a 5.0 mills ad valorem tax (the "Tax") (an estimated $20,200,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of 30 years, commencing with the year 2017, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2046, and shall the proceeds of the Tax (after paying necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used exclusively for the purpose of (a) improving existing public roads, and/or (b) constructing new public roads, within the Parish and City of Baton Rouge as described in the Green Light Plan 2 dated September 28, 2016, and within the cities of Baker, Zachary and Central, on a priority basis determined by the applicable governing authority; and shall the Parish be authorized to fund proceeds of the Tax into bonds; provided that the Parish shall not levy the Tax unless the electorate approves the rededication of a portion of the 1/2% sales tax at the election held in the Parish on December 10, 2016, in order to provide additional funding for road repairs and the community enhancement road projects?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW (Green Light Sales Tax Rededication) -- 1/2% S&U Tax - MC - Perp.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Green Light Sales Tax Rededication)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge ("Parish") be authorized to rededicate a portion of the proceeds of the 1/2% sales tax authorized to be levied through December 31, 2030 remaining after satisfaction of all requirements in the Bond Resolution dated February 8, 2006, effective January 1, 2017, and thereafter, to be used exclusively to provide funds to repair public roads, to construct public roads on a pay-as-you-go basis, and to construct community enhancement road projects, including road repairs, lights and sidewalks, within the Parish and the City of Baton Rouge ("Baton Rouge") and the cities of Baker, Zachary and Central, on a priority basis as determined by the applicable governing authority thereof (except regarding the community enhancement projects in the Parish and Baton Rouge, as set forth in the Green Light Plan 2 dated September 28, 2016); provided the Parish shall not rededicate a portion of the Tax unless the electorate in the Parish also approves the levy of a 5 mills ad valorem tax on December 10, 2016, the proceeds thereof to be used to improve existing public roads, and/or construct public roads, within the Parish and Baton Rouge and Baker, Zachary and Central?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Proposition (Hotel Occupancy Tax) -- 2% Hotel Tax - MC - Perp.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to levy and collect a hotel occupancy tax in the amount of two percent of the rent or fee charged for such occupancy of hotel rooms located within the Parish, but not located within the municipalities of Baker, Central or Zachary, or the area within the boundaries of the Baton Rouge North Economic Development District (an estimated $2,639,645 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the hotel occupancy tax for an entire year), commencing on February 1, 2017, and thereafter, in perpetuity, to be levied and collected by the Parish, fifty percent (50%) of the net proceeds of said hotel occupancy tax (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the hotel occupancy tax) to be used to provide funds for the operation, maintenance and construction of the Baton Rouge River Center and fifty percent (50%) of the net proceeds of said hotel occupancy tax (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the hotel occupancy tax) to be used to fund operation expenses of Visit Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: North Economic Development Dist. -- 2% Hotel Tax - MC - Perp.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Baton Rouge North Economic Development District (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a hotel occupancy tax in the amount of two percent of the rent or fee charged for such occupancy of hotel rooms located within the boundaries of the District (an estimated $261,365 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the hotel occupancy tax for an entire year), commencing on February 1, 2017, and thereafter, in perpetuity, to be levied and collected by the Metropolitan Council of the Parish of East Baton Rouge and City of Baton Rouge, on behalf of the District, for any lawful purpose of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cons. Road Lighting Dist. No. 1 -- 7 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a 7.0 mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $989,240 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), commencing with the tax collection for the year 2019, to and including the tax collection for the year 2028, and shall the proceeds of the Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used entirely and exclusively for the purpose of providing, maintaining and operating electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys, and public places of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Brownsfield Fire Prot. Dist. No. 3 -- 5 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a five (5) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $105,950 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2019, to and including the year 2028, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Chaneyville Fire Prot. Dist. No. 7 (New Tax) -- 10 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition
(New Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a ten (10) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $78,320 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2017, to and including the year 2026, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Chaneyville Fire Prot. Dist. No. 7 (Tax Renewal) -- 10 Mills - MC - 10 yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a ten (10) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $78,320 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2019, to and including the year 2028, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 -- 10 Mills - MC - Perp.
Race.SummaryText: Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a ten (10) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $129,370 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), commencing in the year 2018, and annually thereafter, in perpetuity, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Alsen-St. Irma Lee Fire Prot. Dist. No. 9 -- 5 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Alsen-St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Alsen-St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a five (5) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $86,820 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2019, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2028, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Broadmoor Crime Prev. and Imp. Dist. -- $100/$200 Parcel Fee - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Broadmoor Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the boundaries of the Broadmoor Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District"), be expanded to include North Broadmoor and shall the District be authorized to levy and collect the annual parcel fee on each improved and unimproved parcel within the District upon parcels in North Broadmoor, beginning in 2017 and ending in 2022, in an amount not to exceed One Hundred Dollars ($100) per year and to increase the fee once after 2017 provided said fee does not exceed Two Hundred Dollars ($200) per year, as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.8 with the proceeds of the parcel fee (after deducting administrative costs) to be used to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by providing for an increase in the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District, and to serve the needs of the District's residents by funding beautification and improvements for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $29,100 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Capital Heights Crime Prev. and Imp. Dist. -- $100/$250 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Capital Heights Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Heights Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District") be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee ("Fee") for ten years, beginning in 2017 and ending in 2026, with the Fee for unimproved parcels to be 50% of the Fee for improved parcels and the Fee for parcels subject to the special assessment level provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Louisiana Constitution to be 25% of the Fee for improved parcels, where the initial Fee for improved parcels is $100, which Fee may be increased by the District annually by an amount not to exceed 20% of the Fee for the previous calendar year and with a maximum Fee for improved parcels not to exceed $250, to be used to aid in crime prevention, provide for an increase in security patrols and for the District's overall betterment including but not limited to providing improved lighting, signage, or matters relating to the District's security and for beautification and improvement of the District as provided in Act 292 (2016) ($84,150 is estimated to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Wedgewood Crime Prevention and Improv. Dist. -- $95/$250 & $150/$400 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Wedgewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Wedgewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee on each improved residential and improved commercial parcel within the District for a period of ten years, beginning in 2017 and ending in 2026, in the amount not to exceed $95 per year per parcel zoned residential and $250 per parcel zoned commercial and be authorized to increase the fee twice after at least three years provided said fee does not exceed $150 per year per parcel zoned residential and $400 per year per parcel zoned commercial, as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.3 with the proceeds of the parcel fee (after deducting administrative costs) to be used to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by enhancing security within the District by providing an increase in the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District and an increase in security patrols in the District, to beautify and improve the common areas within the District, and to provide for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $52,500 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Parkwood Terrace Crime Prev. Dist. -- $100/$150 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parkwood Terrace Crime Prevention and 
Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Parkwood Terrace Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee on each improved parcel within the District for a period of ten years, beginning in 2018 and ending in 2027, in the amount not to exceed One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) per year and increase the fee once after at least five years provided said fee does not exceed One Hundred Fifty Dollars ($150.00) per year, as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.28 with proceeds of the parcel (after deducting administrative cost) to be used to aid in crime prevention by providing security for the District residents and to provide funding for beautification and improvements for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $25,000.00 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?
